body_html:
@anj-s clarfications needed. Please help.
If I created a model using estimator then.

  1. If i use distribution startegy as CollectiveAllReduceStrategy or ParameterServerStrategy through RunConfig, then and estimator can be trained distributedly using estimator.train(), there is no need to use train_and_evaluate().
  2. When specifying model_dir in RunConfig using parameter-server appraoch through estimator, the path to directory can be local machine path(chief node), it need not to be a shared file-system path.
  3. When using ParameterServerStrategy, how to use synchronous and stale-synchronus approach, are SyncReplicasOptimizer and DropStaleGradientOptimizer compatible with Distribution strategy ParameterServerStrategy API.

If i use distribution startegy as CollectiveAllReduceStrategy or ParameterServerStrategy through RunConfig, then and estimator can be trained distributedly using estimator.train(), there is no need to use train_and_evaluate().
When specifying model_dir in RunConfig using parameter-server appraoch through estimator, the path to directory can be local machine path(chief node), it need not to be a shared file-system path.
When using ParameterServerStrategy, how to use synchronous and stale-synchronus approach, are SyncReplicasOptimizer and DropStaleGradientOptimizer compatible with Distribution strategy ParameterServerStrategy API.
body:
@anj-s  clarfications needed. Please help.
If I created a model using estimator then.

1. If i use distribution startegy as CollectiveAllReduceStrategy or ParameterServerStrategy through RunConfig, then and estimator can be trained distributedly using estimator.train(), there is no need to use train_and_evaluate().
2. When specifying model_dir in RunConfig using parameter-server appraoch through estimator, the path to directory can be local machine path(chief node), it need not to be a shared file-system path.
3. When using ParameterServerStrategy, how to use synchronous and stale-synchronus approach, are SyncReplicasOptimizer and DropStaleGradientOptimizer compatible with Distribution strategy ParameterServerStrategy API.
